snippet: Joseph J. Lhota and John A. Catsimatidis are seeking to drum up support and turn out hard-to-find conservative voters in Tuesday’s primary.
abstract: Republican New York City mayoral candidates Joseph J Lhota and John A Catsimatidis are seeking support of hard-to-find conservative voters in primary; scarcity of Republicans is challenge for party's leading candidates; only 471,000 of 4.35 million registered voters in city are signed up as Republicans, and as few as 50,000 of them are expected to vote in upcoming primary.
lead_paragraph: Joseph J. Lhota and John A. Catsimatidis are seeking to drum up support and turn out hard-to-find conservative voters in Tuesday’s primary.

headline.main: Republican Candidates Seek Precision From Their Outreach Plans
headline.print_headline: In Home Stretch, Republican Candidates Seek Precision From Their Outreach Plans
